items.name: npm, github, cdn
items.description: You can install xng via npm or download it directly from the xng github repository. Copy the file xng.min.js from node_modules/xng/dist/xng.min.js into the directory you desire. Or include the file via unpkg https://unpkg.com/xng@$version$/dist/xng.min.js

items.name: Requirements
items.description:
xng requires lodash and is tested under the current version 4.17.4.
Include requirements at the end of the body tag to prevent the browser from blocking. Moreover xng is built with the fetch api and therefore requires the browser to support it!

items.name: init xng via javascript
items.description: start your xng in your main entry point. in this website we use the github page's index.html

items.name: Concept
items.description: xng has been designed for offering a short and simple api and therefore works with only 5 HTML5 custom attributes.

items.name: Routing
items.description: xng routing is realized by a router. The default router works with the location's hash value. The second option is to use routing via url query params instead of using the hash value to get a better seo result.

items.name: Choosing a Router
items.description: you can call the _.xng.using method with parameter HashRouter or QueryRouter to select the router of your needs.

items.name: Hash Router
items.description:
hash routing is realized via the url hash value. This means the main page will be accessible e.g. at https://ramsondon.github.io/xng and the changelog page will be athttps://ramsondon.github.io/xng/#changes and
https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/#changelog, https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/#change/log

items.name: Query Router
items.description:
query routing is realized via the url query param.This means the main page will be accessible e.g. at https://ramsondon.github.io/xng and the changelog page will be athttps://ramsondon.github.io/xng/?page=changes and
https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/?page=changelog, https://ramsondon.github.io/xng/?page=change/log

items.name: Transformers
items.description: Transformers are required for transforming the model source data into a json model. the transformer api is fully customizable and can easily be extended.

items.name: data-xng-transform
items.description: the data-xng-transform attribute can be defined as an attribute of a dom element which also has a data-xng-model attribute. if the attribute is present xng uses the specified transformer for model to json transformation before assigning the model to the view. If the data-xng-transform attribute is absent the model will automatically be transformed by a default json transformer.

items.name: Custom transformers
items.description: if a data-xng-transform attribute is defined it's value has to be registered using the transformer's register method. See _.xng.transform(<obj: Object>) : xng

items.name: Transformer Inheritance
items.description: For fully being customizable you can implement your own Transformer Classes by inheriting the default Transformer class. A transformer must implement the doTransformation(<str : string>) : Object method.

items.name: API Reference $version$
items.description: xng's javascript api is being listed in this section

items.name: Initialization Methods
items.description: all methods in this section can be used for xng initialization at startup time

items.name: _.xng.base
items.description: _.xng.base(<path : string>) : xng sets the base directory prefix for loading templates and models and returns the xng object itself for method chaining. _.xng.base() is an initialization method and should be called before calling _.xng.run(). if it is called afterwards it will not have any effect.

items.name: _.xng.listen
items.description: _.xng.listen(<obj : object|string>, <cb : function>) : xng listens to one or more specific view rendered events and returns the xng object for method chaining. see also: View Listener

items.name: _.xng.route
items.description: _.xng.route(<obj : str|object>, [<func : function>]) : xng listens to one or more specified routing events and returns the xng object for method chaining. this method should be called before calling _.xng.run. if the first parameter is a string then the second should be a function. if the first is an object the second is optional. also see Routing

items.name: _.xng.using
items.description: _.xng.using(<obj : str>) : xng sets the routing strategy and returns the xng object for method chaining. this method should be called before calling _.xng.run. See also: Choosing a Router

items.name: _.xng.run
items.description: _.xng.run() : Promise is the xng start up method. Returns a Promise which's resolve method is triggered when all rendering has been finished successfully. if you are using the fetch method in a view it can not be considered for the resovle method of the returned Promise

items.name: _.xng.transform
items.description: _.xng.transform(<obj: Object>) : xng registers one or more model transformers. with this method you can implement your custom model transformers. the default transformer is the json string to json transformer and must not explicitly be assigned. the "data-xng-transform" attribute works only together with the "data-xng-model" attribute. See also Transformers

items.name: View Methods
items.description: all methods in this section can be used in xng's modular defined custom views

items.name: _.xng.assign
items.description: _.xng.assign(<obj : object>) : string serializes an object and escapes the serialized object. this method is used to assign a model to a nested view e.g. an item of an list into a separate item's view. the following example shows the navigation view of this documentation page

items.name: _.xng.fetch
items.description: _.xng.fetch(<resource : string>,<type: string>) : Promisefetches a resource as type "text" or "json". the resource can be an absolute or relative URL. in the example below we see the asynchronous rendering of the CHANGELOG.md file of this project

items.name: _.xng.link
items.description: _.xng.link(<route : string>) : string outputs the correct link depending on routing strategy. See also: Choosing a Router

items.name: _.xng.nl2br
items.description: _.xng.nl2br(<text : string>) : stringreplaces \n to <br/> and returns the new string

items.name: _.xng.put
items.description: _.xng.put(<data : string>, <selector : string>, <trigger : string>) : void puts specific content to a given dom selector. this method is useful to assign asynchronously fetched content to a specific dom element to avoid concurrency problems. the third param is the name of a view listener to be triggered on finished rendering. as an example you can see _.xng.fetch

items.name: Utils
items.description: here we cover all additional useful methods

items.name: _.xng.guid
items.description:
_.xng.guid() : string returns a unique random string with the following format: 
xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
Character range is [a-z] and [0-9]

items.name: _.xng.require
items.description: _.xng.require(<src : array|string>, <attrs : object|array|string>) : Promise includes one or more javascript files asynchronously and returns a Promise. the second parameter attrs is used to define attributes of the script element
